misc.name: BYTE
misc.description: Byte (1 byte, 8 bit)

misc.name: SBYTE
misc.description: Signed Byte (1 byte, 8 bit)

misc.name: WORD
misc.description: Word, Half Precision (2 bytes, 16 bit)

misc.name: SWORD
misc.description: Signed Word, Half Precision (2 bytes, 16 bit)

misc.name: DWORD
misc.description: Double Word, Single Precision (4 bytes, 32 bit)

misc.name: SDWORD
misc.description: Signed Double Word, Single Precision (4 bytes, 32 bit)

misc.name: FWORD
misc.description: (6 bytes, 48 bit).

misc.name: QWORD
misc.description: Quad word, Double Precision (8 bytes, 64 bit)

misc.name: MMWORD
misc.description: Quad word, Double Precision (8 bytes, 64 bit)

misc.name: TWORD
misc.description: Extended (Double) Precision (10 bytes, 80 bit)

misc.name: XMMWORD
misc.description: (16 bytes, 128 bit)

misc.name: OWORD
misc.description: IEEE 754-2008 Quad Precision (16 bytes, 128 bit)

misc.name: YMMWORD
misc.description: (32 bytes, 256 bit)

misc.name: YWORD
misc.description: (32 bytes, 256 bit)

misc.name: ZMMWORD
misc.description: (64 bytes, 512 bit)

misc.name: ZWORD
misc.description: (64 bytes, 512 bit)

misc.name: REAL4
misc.description: MASM: Allocates and optionally initializes a single-precision (4-byte) floating-point number for each initializer.

misc.name: REAL8
misc.description: MASM: Allocates and optionally initializes a double-precision (8-byte) floating-point number for each initializer.

misc.name: REAL10
misc.description: MASM: Allocates and optionally initializes a 10-byte floating-point number for each initializer.

misc.name: TBYTE
misc.description: MASM: Allocates and optionally initializes 10 bytes of storage for each initializer. Can also be used as a type specifier anywhere a type is legal.

misc.name: DB
misc.description: Byte (1 byte, 8 bit). DB is a synonym of BYTE

misc.name: DW
misc.description: Word, Half Precision (2 bytes, 16 bit). DW is a synonym of WORD.

misc.name: DD
misc.description: Double Word, Single Precision (4 bytes, 32 bit). DD is a synonym of DWORD.

misc.name: DF
misc.description: (6 bytes, 48 bit). DF is a synonym of FWORD.

misc.name: DQ
misc.description: Quad word, Double Precision (8 bytes, 64 bit). DQ is a synonym of QWORD.

misc.name: DT
misc.description: Extended (Double) Precision (10 bytes, 80 bit). DT is a synonym of TBYTE.

misc.name: DO
misc.description: IEEE 754-2008 Quad Precision (16 bytes, 128 bit), DO is a synonym of OWORD.

misc.name: DY
misc.description: (32 bytes, 256 bit). DY is a synonym of YWORD.

misc.name: DZ
misc.description: (64 bytes, 512 bit). DZ is a synonym of ZWORD.

misc.name: Z
misc.description: Zero Mask {Z}

misc.name: SAE
misc.description: Suppress all Exceptions {SAE}

misc.name: RN-SAE
misc.description: Rounding Mode: round nearest even {RN-SAE}

misc.name: RU-SAE
misc.description: Rounding Mode: round up {RU-SAE}

misc.name: RD-SAE
misc.description: Rounding Mode: round down {RD-SAE}

misc.name: RZ-SAE
misc.description: Rounding Mode: truncate / round to zero {RZ-SAE}

misc.name: 1TO16
misc.description: Broadcast 1 to 16 {1TO16}

misc.name: 1TO8
misc.description: Broadcast 1 to 8 {1TO8}

misc.name: 1TO4
misc.description: Broadcast 1 to 4 {1TO4}

directive.name: .ALLOCSTACK
directive.description: MASM64: Generates a UWOP_ALLOC_SMALL or a UWOP_ALLOC_LARGE with the specified size for the current offset in the prologue.

directive.name: .ENDPROLOG
directive.description: MASM64: Signals the end of the prologue declarations.

directive.name: .PUSHFRAME
directive.description: MASM64: Generates a UWOP_PUSH_MACHFRAME unwind code entry. If the optional code is specified, the unwind code entry is given a modifier of 1. Otherwise the modifier is 0.

directive.name: .PUSHREG
directive.description: MASM64: Generates a UWOP_PUSH_NONVOL unwind code entry for the specified register number using the current offset in the prologue.

directive.name: .SAVEREG
directive.description: MASM64: Generates either a UWOP_SAVE_NONVOL or a UWOP_SAVE_NONVOL_FAR unwind code entry for the specified register (reg) and offset (offset) using the current prologue offset. MASM will choose the most efficient encoding.

directive.name: .SAVEXMM128
directive.description: MASM64: Generates either a UWOP_SAVE_XMM128 or a UWOP_SAVE_XMM128_FAR unwind code entry for the specified XMM register and offset using the current prologue offset. MASM will choose the most efficient encoding.

directive.name: .SETFRAME
directive.description: MASM64: Fills in the frame register field and offset in the unwind information using the specified register (reg) and offset (offset). The offset must be a multiple of 16 and less than or equal to 240. This directive also generates a UWOP_SET_FPREG unwind code entry for the specified register using the current prologue offset.

directive.name: ALIGN
directive.description: MASM: Aligns the next variable or instruction on a byte that is a multiple of number.

directive.name: EVEN
directive.description: MASM: Aligns the next variable or instruction on an even byte.

directive.name: LABEL
directive.description: MASM: Creates a new label by assigning the current location-counter value and the given type to name.

directive.name: ORG
directive.description: MASM: Sets the location counter to expression.

directive.name: ELSE
directive.description: MASM: Marks the beginning of an alternate block within a conditional block.

directive.name: ELSEIF
directive.description: MASM: Combines ELSE and IF into one statement.

directive.name: ELSEIF2
directive.description: MASM: ELSEIF block evaluated on every assembly pass if OPTION:SETIF2 is TRUE.

directive.name: IF
directive.description: MASM: Grants assembly of ifstatements if expression1 is true (nonzero) or elseifstatements if expression1 is false (0) and expression2 is true.

directive.name: IF2
directive.description: MASM: IF block is evaluated on every assembly pass if OPTION:SETIF2 is TRUE.

directive.name: IFNB
directive.description: MASM: Grants assembly if textitem is not blank.

directive.name: IFB
directive.description: MASM: Grants assembly if textitem is blank.

directive.name: IFDEF
directive.description: MASM: Grants assembly if name is a previously defined label, variable, or symbol.

directive.name: IFNDEF
directive.description: MASM: Grants assembly if name has not been defined.

directive.name: IFDIF
directive.description: MASM: Grants assembly if the text items are different.

directive.name: IFE
directive.description: MASM: Grants assembly if expression is false (0).

directive.name: IFIDN
directive.description: MASM: Grants assembly if the text items are identical.

directive.name: ENDIF
directive.description: MASM:

directive.name: ALIAS
directive.description: MASM: The ALIAS directive creates an alternate name for a function.

directive.name: .BREAK
directive.description: MASM: Generates code to terminate a .WHILE or .REPEAT block if condition is true.

directive.name: .CONTINUE
directive.description: MASM: Generates code to jump to the top of a .WHILE or .REPEAT block if condition is true.

directive.name: .ELSE
directive.description: MASM: Generates code to jump to the top of a .WHILE or .REPEAT block if condition is false.

directive.name: .ELSIF
directive.description: MASM: Generates code that tests condition1 (for example, AX > 7) and executes the statements if that condition is true.

directive.name: .ENDIF
directive.description: MASM:

directive.name: .ENDW
directive.description: MASM:

directive.name: .IF
directive.description: MASM: Generates code that tests condition1 (for example, AX > 7) and executes the statements if that condition is true.

directive.name: .REPEAT
directive.description: MASM: Generates code that repeats execution of the block of statements until condition becomes true. .UNTILCXZ, which becomes true when CX is zero, may be substituted for .UNTIL. The condition is optional with .UNTILCXZ.

directive.name: .UNTIL
directive.description: MASM: Generates code that repeats execution of the block of statements until condition becomes true. .UNTILCXZ, which becomes true when CX is zero, may be substituted for .UNTIL. The condition is optional with .UNTILCXZ.

directive.name: .UNTILCXZ
directive.description: MASM: Generates code that repeats execution of the block of statements until condition becomes true. .UNTILCXZ, which becomes true when CX is zero, may be substituted for .UNTIL. The condition is optional with .UNTILCXZ.

directive.name: .WHILE
directive.description: MASM: Generates code that executes the block of statements while condition remains true.

directive.name: .ERR
directive.description: MASM: Generates an error.

directive.name: .ERR2
directive.description: MASM: .ERR block evaluated on every assembly pass if OPTION:SETIF2 is TRUE.

directive.name: .ERRB
directive.description: MASM: Generates an error if textitem is blank.

directive.name: .ERRDEF
directive.description: MASM: Generates an error if name is a previously defined label, variable, or symbol.

directive.name: .ERRDIF
directive.description: MASM: Generates an error if the text items are different.

directive.name: .ERRE
directive.description: MASM: Generates an error if expression is false (0).

directive.name: .ERRIDN
directive.description: MASM: Generates an error if the text items are identical.

directive.name: .ERRNB
directive.description: MASM: Generates an error if textitem is not blank.

directive.name: .ERRNDEF
directive.description: MASM: Generates an error if name has not been defined.

directive.name: .ERRNZ
directive.description: MASM: Generates an error if expression is true (nonzero).

directive.name: EQU
directive.description: MASM: The first directive assigns numeric value of expression to name.

directive.name: TEXTEQU
directive.description: MASM: Assigns textitem to name. The textitem can be a literal string, a constant preceded by a %, or the string returned by a macro function.

directive.name: .CREF
directive.description: MASM: Enables listing of symbols in the symbol portion of the symbol table and browser file.

directive.name: .LIST
directive.description: MASM: Starts listing of statements.

directive.name: .LISTALL
directive.description: MASM: Starts listing of all statements.

directive.name: .LISTIF
directive.description: MASM: Starts listing of statements in false conditional blocks.

directive.name: .LISTMACRO
directive.description: MASM: Starts listing of macro expansion statements that generate code or data.

directive.name: .LISTMACROALL
directive.description: MASM: Starts listing of all statements in macros.

directive.name: .NOCREF
directive.description: MASM: Suppresses listing of symbols in the symbol table and browser file.

directive.name: PAGE
directive.description: MASM: The first directive sets line length and character width of the program listing. If no arguments are given, generates a page break. The second directive increments the section number and resets the page number to 1.

directive.name: SUBTITLE
directive.description: MASM: Defines the listing subtitle. Same as SUBTTL.

directive.name: .TFCOND
directive.description: Toggles listing of false conditional blocks.

directive.name: TITLE
directive.description: MASM: Defines the program listing title.

directive.name: ENDM
directive.description: MASM: Terminates a macro or repeat block.

directive.name: EXITM
directive.description: MASM: Terminates expansion of the current repeat or macro block and begins assembly of the next statement outside the block.

directive.name: GOTO
directive.description: MASM: Transfers assembly to the line marked :macrolabel.

directive.name: LOCAL
directive.description: MASM: In the first directive, within a macro, LOCAL defines labels that are unique to each instance of the macro.

directive.name: MACRO
directive.description: MASM: Marks a macro block called name and establishes parameter placeholders for arguments passed when the macro is called.

directive.name: PURGE
directive.description: MASM: Deletes the specified macros from memory.

directive.name: ASSUME
directive.description: MASM: Enables error checking for register values.

directive.name: COMMENT
directive.description: MASM: Treats all text between or on the same line as the delimiters as a comment.

directive.name: ECHO
directive.description: MASM: Displays message to the standard output device (by default, the screen).

directive.name: END
directive.description: MASM: Marks the end of a module and, optionally, sets the program entry point to address.

directive.name: .FPO
directive.description: MASM: The .FPO directive controls the emission of debug records to the .debug$F segment or section.

directive.name: INCLUDE
directive.description: MASM: Inserts source code from the source file given by filename into the current source file during assembly.

directive.name: INCLUDELIB
directive.description: MASM: Informs the linker that the current module should be linked with libraryname.

directive.name: OPTION
directive.description: MASM: Enables and disables features of the assembler.

directive.name: POPCONTEXT
directive.description: MASM: Restores part or all of the current context (saved by the PUSHCONTEXT directive). The context can be ASSUMES, RADIX, LISTING, CPU, or ALL.

directive.name: PUSHCONTEXT
directive.description: MASM: Saves part or all of the current context: segment register assumes, radix value, listing and cref flags, or processor/coprocessor values. The context can be ASSUMES, RADIX, LISTING, CPU, or ALL.

directive.name: .RADIX
directive.description: MASM: Sets the default radix, in the range 2 to 16, to the value of expression.

directive.name: .SAFESEH
directive.description: MASM: Registers a function as a structured exception handler.

directive.name: ENDP
directive.description: MASM: Marks the end of procedure name previously begun with PROC.

directive.name: INVOKE
directive.description: MASM: Calls the procedure at the address given by expression, passing the arguments on the stack or in registers according to the standard calling conventions of the language type.

directive.name: PROC
directive.description: MASM: Marks start and end of a procedure block called label. The statements in the block can be called with the CALL instruction or INVOKE directive.

directive.name: PROTO
directive.description: MASM: Prototypes a function.
MASM: Enables assembly of nonprivileged instructions for the 80386 processor; disables assembly of instructions introduced with later processors.

directive.name: .386P
directive.description: MASM: Enables assembly of all instructions (including privileged) for the 80386 processor; disables assembly of instructions introduced with later processors.
MASM: Enables assembly of instructions for the 80387 coprocessor.
MASM: Enables assembly of nonprivileged instructions for the 80486 processor.

directive.name: .486P
directive.description: MASM: Enables assembly of all instructions (including privileged) for the 80486 processor.
MASM: Enables assembly of nonprivileged instructions for the Pentium processor.

directive.name: .586P
directive.description: MASM: Enables assembly of all instructions (including privileged) for the Pentium processor.
MASM: Enables assembly of nonprivileged instructions for the Pentium Pro processor.

directive.name: .686P
directive.description: MASM: Enables assembly of all instructions (including privileged) for the Pentium Pro processor.

directive.name: .K3D
directive.description: MASM: Enables assembly of K3D instructions.

directive.name: .MMX
directive.description: MASM: Enables assembly of MMX or single-instruction, multiple data (SIMD) instructions.

directive.name: .XMM
directive.description: MASM: Enables assembly of Internet Streaming SIMD Extension instructions.

directive.name: FOR
directive.description: MASM: Marks a block that will be repeated once for each argument, with the current argument replacing parameter on each repetition.

directive.name: FORC
directive.description: MASM: Marks a block that will be repeated once for each character in string, with the current character replacing parameter on each repetition.

directive.name: COMM
directive.description: MASM: Creates a communal variable with the attributes specified in definition.

directive.name: EXTRN
directive.description: MASM: Defines one or more external variables, labels, or symbols called name whose type is type.

directive.name: EXTERN
directive.description: MASM: Defines one or more external variables, labels, or symbols called name whose type is type.

directive.name: EXTERNDEF
directive.description: MASM: Defines one or more external variables, labels, or symbols called name whose type is type.

directive.name: PUBLIC
directive.description: MASM: Makes each variable, label, or absolute symbol specified as name available to all other modules in the program.

directive.name: .ALPHA
directive.description: MASM: Orders segments alphabetically.

directive.name: .DOSSEG
directive.description: MASM: Orders the segments according to the MS-DOS segment convention: CODE first, then segments not in DGROUP, and then segments in DGROUP.

directive.name: ENDS
directive.description: MASM: Marks the end of segment, structure, or union name previously begun with SEGMENT, STRUCT, UNION, or a simplified segment directive.

directive.name: GROUP
directive.description: MASM: Add the specified segments to the group called name.

directive.name: SEGMENT
directive.description: MASM: Defines a program segment called name having segment attributes

directive.name: .SEQ
directive.description: MASM: Orders segments sequentially (the default order).

directive.name: .CODE
directive.description: MASM: When used with .MODEL, indicates the start of a code segment.

directive.name: .CONST
directive.description: MASM: When used with .MODEL, starts a constant data segment (with segment name CONST).

directive.name: .DATA
directive.description: MASM: When used with .MODEL, starts a near data segment for initialized data (segment name _DATA).

directive.name: .DATA?
directive.description: MASM: When used with .MODEL, starts a near data segment for uninitialized data (segment name _BSS).

directive.name: .EXIT
directive.description: MASM: Generates termination code.

directive.name: .FARDATA
directive.description: MASM: When used with .MODEL, starts a far data segment for initialized data (segment name FAR_DATA or name).

directive.name: .FARDATA?
directive.description: MASM: When used with .MODEL, starts a far data segment for uninitialized data (segment name FAR_BSS or name).

directive.name: .MODEL
directive.description: MASM: Initializes the program memory model.

directive.name: .STACK
directive.description: MASM: When used with .MODEL, defines a stack segment (with segment name STACK). The optional size specifies the number of bytes for the stack (default 1,024). The .STACK directive automatically closes the stack statement.

directive.name: .STARTUP
directive.description: MASM: Generates program start-up code.

directive.name: CATSTR
directive.description: MASM: Concatenates text items.

directive.name: INSTR
directive.description: MASM: Finds the first occurrence of textitem2 in textitem1.

directive.name: SIZESTR
directive.description: MASM: Finds the size of a text item.

directive.name: SUBSTR
directive.description: MASM: Returns a substring of textitem, starting at position. The textitem can be a literal string, a constant preceded by a %, or the string returned by a macro function.

directive.name: RECORD
directive.description: MASM: Declares a record type consisting of the specified fields. fieldname names the field, width specifies the number of bits, and expression gives its initial value.

directive.name: STRUCT
directive.description: MASM: Declares a structure type having the specified fielddeclarations. Each field must be a valid data definition. Same as STRUC.

directive.name: TYPEDEF
directive.description: MASM: Defines a new type called name, which is equivalent to type.

directive.name: UNION
directive.description: MASM: Declares a union of one or more data types. The fielddeclarations must be valid data definitions. Omit the ENDS name label on nested UNION definitions.
